title: Mixed Signal Integrated Circuits Design 2021
desc: This course covers fundamentals of data converters, Nyquist-rate converters ,central concept of oversampling and CMOS Image sensor design. This course is intended for those who seek to learn more about mixed-signal (analog plus digital) circuit design, analysis, and application. The course starts with sampling circuits, then building blocks for data converters - Opamps and Comparators, later the architecture of DACs and ADCs are covered.

content.title: Unit 1 | Lecture 1 | Mixed Signal Design Overview
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the overview of Mixed Signal Design.

content.title: Unit 1 | Lecture 2 | Dynamic Analog Circuits
content.shortDesc: This lecture covers the introduction to dynamic analog circuits - Sampling switches. This lecture covers the ability of MOSFET to exchange the roles of source and drain via two examples..

content.title: Unit 1 | Lecture 3 | Sampling Switches - Speed Considerations
content.shortDesc: In this video you will learn about the speed considerations of a sampling switch, how to define speed of a sampling switch, factors affecting the switching speed and the resistance of NMOS switch, PMOS switch and Transmission Gate Switch..
